clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Prescribed Cardiac Rehabilitation in Patients With Advanced Heart Failure or Ventricular Assist Device
clinical_study.official_title: Examination of the Effect of Prescribed Cardiac Rehabilitation on Quality of Life, Exercise Capacity and Course of Disease in Patients With Advanced Heart Failure or After Ventricular Assist Device Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will evaluate the effect of prescribed exercise training on quality of life and exercise capacity of patients with advanced heart failure or after ventricular assist device implantation. Furthermore, clinical, laboratory and echocardiographic markers of heart failure, rehospitalization rates and cost-effectiveness will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of exercise training in severe heart failure as assessed by quality of life
primary_outcome.description: Change of quality of life by Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of exercise training in severe heart failure as assessed by exercise capacity
primary_outcome.description: Change of exercise capacity measured by six-minute walking distance in meters

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months before training and 12 months while training
secondary_outcome.description: Change in rehospitalization rate or unplanned outpatient healthcare visits due to symptoms of heart failure measured by a final visit and record screening
Change in biomarkers of heart failure: NTproBNP
Change in biomarkers of renal function: creatinin

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal function biomarkers: glomerular Filtration rate
secondary_outcome.description: Change in biomarkers of renal function: glomerular filtration rate
Change in biomarkers of hepatic function: transaminases
Change in biomarkers of hepatic function: gamma-glutamyltransferase
Change of echocardiographic findings: ejection fraction (in %)
Change of echocardiographic findings: diameters (in mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart failure Progression: Aortic Valve opening
secondary_outcome.description: Change of echocardiographic findings: aortic valve opening
Change of echocardiographic findings: Valvular regurgitation (in grades I-IIIÂ°)

arm_group.description: 14 participants will absolve a prescribed exercise training for 12 months.

intervention.description: exercise training in an approved rehabilitation program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age >17 years
- written informed consent
- chronic end-stage systolic heart failure with or without ventricular assist device
- clinically stable for at least 6 weeks
- prescription of cardiac rehabilitation
Exclusion Criteria:
- addictions or other illnesses that impact the ability to understand the nature, scope and consequences of the trial
- lack of knowledge of German to fully understand study information
- pregnancy, pre-menopausal women
- participation in the rehabilitation program < 80%
- contraindications of cardiopulmonary exercise testing on an ergometer
